metadata.title: CVE-2023-29536 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could cause the memory manager to incorrectly free a pointerthat addresses attacker-controlled memory, resulting in an assertion,memory corruption, or a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 112, Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10,Firefox for Android < 112, and Thunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
